intro: Kyrstenia arizonica, commonly known as Arizona kyrstenia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are compound, with finely divided leaflets, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Kyrstenia arizonica is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, contributing to local biodiversity.
